biogHist.abstract: Allandale Cottage was established in 1962 by the Methodist Homes for Children in Sussex Street, Victoria Park. Allandale began as a boys' cottage but the policy changed to admit girls and keep sibling groups together in a home-like setting. Allandale Cottage closed around 1985.
biogHist.p: Allandale Cottage, although situated close to Mofflyn Child and Family Care Services, was run as a separate entity. It is not clear exactly when Allandale Cottage closed, but it is likely to have been by 1985 as most of the campus cottages had closed by then.

archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1978 edition, published under the banner of the Uniting Church Child and Family Care Services. It has a map and a list of all the Homes in the metropolitan area that came under the control of the Uniting Church after the union of the Methodist, Presbyterian and Congregational churches in 1977. There is an article about how some children came into care and also news about how some of the Homes are funded. There is some specific information about Terrace House, Sister Kate Clutterbuck and the Mogumber Training Centre. The newsletter appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1974 edition. It has a picture of some young children 'helping out' by sweeping the front steps at Mofflyn. There are also photos of other children and buildings. The news items give a small amount of information about each Home and news about the staff. The newsletter also appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1970 edition. It has a picture of some children playing at Mofflyn and a photo of the front of the Allandale Boys' Cottage at 149 Sussex Street. The news items give a small amount of information about each Home and talk about some planned 'scatter homes'. There is news about the retirement of Matron Roberts and a photo of her with some kindergarten children. The newsletter also appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1966 edition. It has a picture of the new hostel ('Cooinda') in Mt Lawley and a photo of some young women who lived there. There are also photos of buildings at the Mofflyn site in Victoria Park and a photo of children with 'Father Christmas'. There is news about donations and activities in the other Homes. The newsletter also tells readers how they can help.

archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. The December 1965 edition is held in the Children's Homes File at the Uniting Church Archive in Perth. This edition has a photo of some kindergarten children acting in their Christmas play. There are also photos of buildings and children at the Mofflyn site in Victoria Park and information about the Homes and children's activities.
This is a picture of the front entrance of Allandale Boys' Cottage. It comes from the December 1970 edition of the Methodist Homes for Children's newsletter, called The 'Homes' Herald.
